course_title: Spec Topics: History: American Foreign Policy
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 50 / Seats Avail: 34Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: Starting with the Spanish-American War of 1898, the course will trace the rise of the United States as a twentieth-century superpower. Topics will include: World War I and the Treaty of Versailles, the rise of Hitler and World War II, the Cold War and nuclear weapons, America's relationship with Israel, and the roles played by trade, oil, human rights, and cultural affairs in the shaping of American diplomacy. Two short and one long papers, one midterm and a final exam.
course_description: Selected topics in history for advanced students. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
